seo.title: Path of the Gods via Nocelle shuttle
seo.description: Take the Montepertuso–Nocelle shuttle for a simple out-and-back hike on the Sentiero degli Dei, with step-by-step orientation photos and timing ideas.

linkLabel: Path of the Gods: Short Hike from Nocelle
intro: This guide is one of three routes we have produced for the Path of the Gods. The other two are %LINK:pathOfTheGodsFerry|Path of the Gods via Amalfi (ferry)% and %LINK:pathOfTheGodsBus|Path of the Gods via Amalfi (bus)%. If you are not sure which one to do, start with our %LINK:pathOfTheGods|overview%.

The Nocelle route is the simplest logistics: catch the Montepertuso–Nocelle bus, walk out on the Sentiero degli Dei toward Colle Serra, then retrace your steps back to Nocelle and ride the same bus down.

sections.title: Scan, prep, and buy tickets
body: Buy two bus tickets per person at Bar Internazionale: Positano → Nocelle and Nocelle → Positano. If you are unsure which ticket type to get, ask reception or the staff at the bar.
Bus times are subject to seasonal changes, so confirm the Montepertuso/Nocelle timetable before you leave. A guide to bus times and a map can be found in reception.
Plan to set off in the morning to avoid the hottest part of the day and ensure you have plenty of time to complete the hike.

sections.title: Ride the bus up to Nocelle
body: Head to Bar Internazionale to buy your tickets, then wait outside for the bus. You can also catch it from Chiesa Nuova (the stop beside the church).
The bus will say “Montepertuso - Nocelle”. Validate your ticket when you board.
Stay on until the final stop in Nocelle. The bus terminates at a small car park, then turns around to head downhill again.

images.alt: Bus stop location outside Bar Internazionale in Positano
images.caption: 1. Bus stop outside Bar Internazionale (you can also board at Chiesa Nuova)

images.alt: Nocelle bus turning point at the small car park (final stop)
images.caption: 2. Get off at the final stop in Nocelle (the small car park where the bus turns around)

sections.title: Walk through Nocelle to the trail entrance
body: From the car park, walk down the stairs to reach the main walkway.
At the bottom, turn left and walk through the village toward the Sentiero degli Dei signs.
At the key junction, ignore the signs pointing down to Positano (stairs). Stay on the main route for the trail.

images.alt: Stairway leading down from the Nocelle car park bus stop to the village walkway
images.caption: 3. Walk down these stairs from the car park

images.alt: Main pedestrian walkway in Nocelle where you should turn left
images.caption: 4. At the bottom, turn left and follow the main walkway through Nocelle

images.alt: Directional signpost warning about the stairs down to Positano
images.caption: 5. Ignore the signs down to Positano (stairs) and continue toward Sentiero degli Dei

sections.title: Hike as far as you like
body: Once you reach the trail entrance, follow the Sentiero degli Dei markers toward Colle Serra for the best viewpoints.
You can turn around whenever you like. If you continue all the way to Bomerano, expect a longer day; most people prefer this route as a simple out-and-back from Nocelle.
There are no facilities along the trail, so bring plenty of water. If you want a budget-friendly lunch, consider picking up a panini from the mini-market before you start.

images.alt: Trail entrance notice board and sign for Sentiero degli Dei (Path of the Gods)
images.caption: 6. Follow the Sentiero degli Dei signs from the trail entrance notice board

sections.title: Return to Positano
body: Retrace your steps back to Nocelle the same way you came. At the key junction, keep to the main route back toward the car park and bus stop.
Use your return ticket for the bus down to Bar Internazionale or Chiesa Nuova. If the bus is full, you can walk the paved road (about 4 km) but allow 45–60 minutes.
Avoid the stairs down to Positano unless you intentionally want a long, knee-testing descent that ends far from the hostel.

sections.title: Sample timings (indicative)
body: These timings are indicative only: everyone walks at different speeds, and bus timetables vary by season.

essentials: Two bus tickets per person (uphill and downhill) plus a spare.
Plenty of water — there are no facilities along the trail.
Snacks or a packed lunch, sunscreen, and a hat for the exposed ridge.
Comfortable shoes with grip for uneven steps.
typicalCosts: Nocelle shuttle tickets: €1.80–€2.40 per leg depending on carnet.
Granita or drinks from the Nocelle kiosk: €3–€5.
tips: Set off in the morning for cooler temperatures and more buffer time for the return bus.
Do not forget to bring plenty of water — there are no facilities along the trail.
For a budget-friendly lunch, pick up a panini from a mini-market before you start hiking.
warnings: Ignore the sign pointing down the stairs to Positano unless you want a strenuous descent that ends far from the hostel.
Buses run less frequently in the afternoon — set an alarm for the last return you can comfortably make.
The trail is exposed; avoid hiking in the hottest part of the day during July and August.

steps.name: Buy bus tickets
steps.text: Purchase Nocelle tickets at Bar Internazionale before leaving the hostel.

steps.name: Ride to Nocelle
steps.text: Catch the Montepertuso–Nocelle bus and stay on until it turns around at the car park.

steps.name: Reach the trail
steps.text: Follow the pedestrian path through town, keeping right to find the Sentiero degli Dei signs.

steps.name: Hike out-and-back
steps.text: Walk toward Colle Serra, turning around whenever you are ready to return.

steps.name: Return to Positano
steps.text: Retrace your steps to the bus stop and ride back to Bar Internazionale or Chiesa Nuova.

faqs.q: How long should I hike before turning around?
a: Many hikers continue 45–60 minutes toward Colle Serra for the most famous viewpoints, then retrace their steps. Allow more time if you plan to reach Bomerano.
Yes, but it runs on a fixed timetable with longer gaps midday. Check the posted schedule at Bar Internazionale and plan a buffer in case the bus is full.

faqs.q: Can I walk down instead of taking the bus?
a: You can descend the paved road in about 45–60 minutes. Avoid the staircase unless you specifically want a workout and are comfortable with thousands of steps.
